[Anchors](https://www.wix.com/support/html5/article/about-anchors)
 are invisible position markers which you can place anywhere on your site.
description: Use anchors to direct users to important sections on a page.

FAQs.title: How do I scroll to a specific point on my page?
FAQs.markdown:
Add an anchor to your page and use the [`scrollTo()`](https://www.wix.com/code/reference/$w.Anchor.html#scrollTo) function. 

You can also use [`scrollTo()`](https://www.wix.com/code/reference/$w.Element.html#scrollTo) to scroll to a specific element on your page, or use [`scrollTo()`](https://www.wix.com/code/reference/wix-window-frontend.html#scrollTo) with [`wix-window-frontend`](https://www.wix.com/code/reference/wix-window-frontend.html#scrollTo) to scroll to an x-y coordinate on your page.

FAQs.title: Since anchors are invisible to your site visitors, which event handlers can you add to anchors?
FAQs.markdown: You can add event handlers when the anchor enters or leaves the viewable part of the current window using [`onViewportEnter()`](https://www.wix.com/code/reference/$w.Anchor.html#onViewportEnter) and [`onViewportLeave()`](https://www.wix.com/code/reference/$w.Anchor.html#onViewportLeave).
